turns.speaker: BARREL
turns.text: ... Let's draw straws.

turns.speaker: SHOCK
turns.text: Jack said we should work together.

turns.speaker: BARREL
turns.text: Three of a kind...

turns.speaker: BARREL
turns.text: Not at all!

turns.speaker: SHOCK
turns.text: We can handle it.

turns.speaker: BARREL
turns.text: He sure is big, Jack...

turns.speaker: SHOCK
turns.text: And heavy...

turns.speaker: BARREL
turns.text: Where're we taking him?

turns.speaker: SHOCK
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: EVIL SCIENTIST
turns.text: The deadly nightshade you slipped me wore off, Sally... I thought I'd find you here....

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: EVIL SCIENTIST
turns.text: For this.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: EVIL SCIENTIST
turns.text: Didn't I tell you?  I'm always right, you know, my dear... Aren't I?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: EVIL SCIENTIST
turns.text: You're mine, you know.  I made you.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: EVIL SCIENTIST
turns.text: If you went away, what would become of me?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I'm grown up now.  I have to leave some time.

turns.speaker: EVIL SCIENTIST
turns.text: Of course you do, and I want you to... but there's no need to hurry it along, is there?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I can't help it.

turns.speaker: EVIL SCIENTIST
turns.text: That's twice this month you've slipped Deadly Night Shade into my tea and run off.  People might get the wrong idea and think you're unhappy at home.

turns.speaker: EVIL SCIENTIST
turns.text: I do the best I can to make it comfortable for us here.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: EVIL SCIENTIST
turns.text: But I guess my best just isn't good enough.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: That's not true.  It's a beautiful home, wonderfully comfortable... I'm indebted to you for everything... It's just...

turns.speaker: EVIL SCIENTIST
turns.text: Just what?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Just me, I suppose...  I'm restless.  I can't help it.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Coming...

turns.speaker: EVIL SCIENTIST
turns.text: Good.  I'm hungry.

turns.speaker: EVIL SCIENTIST
turns.text: What trail are you trying to throw me off now?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Nothing.  W-w-what are you talking about?

turns.speaker: EVIL SCIENTIST
turns.text: Taste it.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: But why?  It's <u>your</u> lunch. There isn't much there in the first place.

turns.speaker: EVIL SCIENTIST
turns.text: Taste it.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: EVIL SCIENTIST
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I'm not hungry.  What's wrong?  I spent all morning on that soup.  I thought you liked Worm's Wart.

turns.speaker: EVIL SCIENTIST
turns.text: There's nothing more suspicious than Worm's Wart -- it distracts one from every other taste and smell.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: But I have to go out. Something's happening out there.

turns.speaker: EVIL SCIENTIST
turns.text: Whatever it is, it's none of your concern.

turns.speaker: EVIL SCIENTIST
turns.text: Then we'll both starve...  An old man like me, who hardly has strength as it is -- me, without whom... me, your own father...

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Can't you make other creations?

turns.speaker: EVIL SCIENTIST
turns.text: I could.  Of course I could. But no one would be like you...  I'll never understand how you can be so cold-hearted, how you can treat me this way, discarding me like--

turns.speaker: EVIL SCIENTIST
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: He stayed a long time.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: When he left, he took a lot of equipment with him.

turns.speaker: EVIL SCIENTIST
turns.text: He's conducting experiments of his own.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Experiments?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: This is a thing called a present. The whole thing starts with a box...

turns.speaker: VARIOUS PEOPLE
turns.text: -- A box? -- Is it steel? -- Are there locks? -- Is it filled with a pox? -- A pox! -- How delightful, a pox!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Just a box with bright colored paper And the whole thing topped with a bow.

turns.speaker: VARIOUS PEOPLE
turns.text: -- A bow? -- But why? -- How ugly! -- What's in it? -- What's in it?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That's the point of the thing, not to know!

turns.speaker: VARIOUS PEOPLE
turns.text: -- It's a bat. -- Will it bend? -- It's a rat. -- Will it break? -- Perhaps it's the head that I found in the lake.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Listen now, you don't understand. That's not the point of Christmasland.

turns.speaker: LOCK
turns.text: We're here!  You sent for us!

turns.speaker: SHOCK
turns.text: Specifically.

turns.speaker: LOCK
turns.text: ... Birds of a feather.

turns.speaker: SHOCK
turns.text: Now and forever...

turns.speaker: SHOCK
turns.text: I say that we take a cannon Aim it at his door and then Knock three times and when he answers Sandy Claws will be no more.

turns.speaker: LOCK
turns.text: You're so stupid, think now -- If we blow him up to smithereens, We may lose some pieces and then Jack will beat us black and green.

turns.speaker: SHOCK
turns.text: ... You're no fun.

turns.speaker: LOCK
turns.text: Shut up and listen...!

turns.speaker: LOCK
turns.text: You'd better be quiet, Sandy.

turns.speaker: SHOCK
turns.text: Maybe he doesn't know...

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: You got your room straightened out yet?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: It's getting there.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: We've only been living here six weeks now.  I want that room unpacked by tonight.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: I know what's wrong with the air coditioning - just needs a shot of freon, is all.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Dad's fixin' something again.  Hit the deck!

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Don't be a smart ass.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: That's Lisa - I gotta get to school.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Who's Lisa?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Just out for a while.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: I told you I want that room unpacked.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Oh, come on Dad...

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: No.  Upstairs.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Help me with this thing!

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: It's not the gas, Dad!

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Don't tell me it's not the gas!

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: You set this all up, didn't you?  One of your sick jokes?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: You know what I'm talking about.  What did you use, a fire cracker?  A cherry bomb?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: I don't know.  COuldn't get the right price, I suppose.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: And you don't know anything about a murder across the street and a crazy girl who lived here - who saw the whole thing?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Oh, come on, Shirl, how'd you think we got such a good deal?  Listen - all old houses have stories.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Did they tell you she went totally out of her mind - that they had to put her away?  And that her mother killed herself in our living room?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Don't tell me it's not the gas!  Your mother thought she smelled gas.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: I wasn't sure, Ken...

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Alright then, what is it?  Bird rabies? That cheap seed you've been buying?

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Oh, please...

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: What is it then?  There's got to be an explanation.  Animals just don't burst into flames for no reason!

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Come back here!

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Ken!

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: He needs professional help.  I think we should take him to a psychiatrist.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Are you nuts or something?  What the hell is that going to do?

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: I don't know!  I just know he needs help and we don't know how to give it to him.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Jesse, help!

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: I'm Jesse now, Lisa.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Oh, God, Jesse - I know you're there! Stop him!

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Jesse's dead, Lisa.  Freddy's here.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Wanna join your little friend?

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Where's Jesse?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: There is no Jesse.  I'm Jesse now.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: I want him back.  Jesse, talk to me. Jesse!

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: I'm not afraid of you.  You couldn't kill me...He's in there and I want him back.  I'm gonna take him away from you and you're going straight back to hell, you son-of-a-bitch!

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Jesse's dead!  I sliced 'im real good!

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: I love you, Jesse.  Come back to me.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: He's dead, you bitch.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: I'll kill you now.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: He can't hold you Jesse.  He's losing his grip - you can get out.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: He'll die with me!

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: How much longer you figure he'll keep us out here?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Could be all night.  Guy gets his rocks off like this. Hangs out in queer S & M joints downtown.  Likes prettyboys like you.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Get outa here.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: So, what about you and that Poletti girl?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: What about it?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: You two got a thing going, or what?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: She's a neighbor, I drive her to school.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: She giving you any carfare for the ride?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: You got a problem with me, Grady?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Naw. Just killing time.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: So, you live around here.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Not too far.  My folks bought a place over on Elm Street.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Elm Street?  You telling me you moved in to that big white house with the bars on the windows?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Yeah, why?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Shit, you can tell your old man he's a real chump.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: What the hell are you talking about?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: They've only been trying to unload that dump for five years.  That place is bad news.  Some chick was locked in there by her mother and she went crazy.  She watched her boyfriend get butchered by some maniac in the house across the street. Her poor drunken momma took her own life right inside your front door.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: You hit that ball pretty good, Walsh.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: It was okay.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Who told you to choke up that way?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: My Dad.  He played in the minors for a while, when he got out of college.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: No shit.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Schneider shouldn't have called you out on that double.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Yeah, well, Schneider's got a stick up his ass today.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Schneider's always got a stick up his ass.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: You remember your dreams, Grady?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Only the wet ones.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Oh Jesus.  I'm gonna be sick.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: He must've been working late and some fruitcake came in and sliced him up like a kielbasa.  In the shower!  Left bloody footprints all over the...

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: You're wasting your time, the guy's a basket case.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Shut up, Grady.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Jesus Christ, you scared the shit out of me!

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I'm sorry...

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: You gotta let me stay here tonight, Grady.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Are you nuts or something?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Listen to me, Grady, this is serious. Something really weird is happening.  It started out like just bad dreams but it's getting real bad.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: You're fucked in the head.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I'm scared, Grady.  I know it sounds crazy.  But, there's something trying to get into my body.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: The only thing trying to get into your body is female and waiting for you on a cabana floor.  And you want to sleep with me.  Go figure.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Look, I don't care if you believe me or not...

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: I believe you.  You had some scary dreams, okay?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: No!  I don't know - everything's all mixed up.  What difference does it make?  I'm in trouble here.  I need your help.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Okay, schmuck.  What do you want me to do?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Just watch me.  If anything weird happens - like if I start dreaming weird or try to walk out of here, you gotta try to bring me out of it. his me over the head if you have to. Just don't let me leave.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: It's happening again.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: your timing was perfect - I was getting the third degree in there.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: How come?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Ah, nothing.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Aren't you afraid somebody could steal your car like that?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Look at this car.  Are you kidding?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Hi!  You didn't have to wait.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: That's okay, I wanted to.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Yeah, yeah, sure.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Let me look at your eye...

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: You shouldn't be fighting with that jerk.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Who, Grady?  Grady's alright, he's just a hothead.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: You mean a shithead.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: No, that's okay.  I was just...unpacking.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: I figured you might like some help.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: You know her?

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Uh-uh.  Before my time.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: I think it's sad...

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Traumas of a ten-year old.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: "March 7th - Glen asked me to sleep with him again.  I can't yet - I like him, I want to make him happy but I'm not sure that I love him. I can't sleep with someone I don't love."

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: That's typical.  I hope she didn't expect to make the best seller list with this thing.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: "Rod's been killed - he got Rod. Just Glen and me now.  Can't fall asleep!"

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Wow...

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Are you okay.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Something Grady told me today about the people that lived here last. Girl went crazy - saw her boyfriend killed in the house across the street...

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: World History.  But, I'll see you in the morning, right?

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: This is amazing!  Your dream told you where this was?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Only it was more like, you know, sleep- walking.  All I know is I woke up on the cellar floor next to it.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: That's when she started talking about Fred Krueger.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Fred Krueger.  The guy in her dream who's coming to kill her.  Seems he was a real guy, ten years before who went around kidnapping kids and killing them.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: No. Never.  You think that's what it is?

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Sorry.  Schneider id it to me again.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: I just got here myself.  Went to the Public Library.  Cut four classes!

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: What's all this.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Research.  Hi.  C'mon, let's go for a ride.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: At first I wasn't sure because you said that you never had anyting like last night happen before.  But I found out that most people have the potential for tuning in to "the other world" and neve do.  It has something to do with the environment - like they have to be in a place that's sending signals.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Like a haunted house, right?  I don't believe in ghosts.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: You don't have to.  You just have to believe in energy.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Look, you got electricity in your body, right?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Yeah, I know...synapses neurong...

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: And heat and chemical reactions. Where does it all go when you die?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I don't know - into the air I suppose.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Make a left at this corner.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: What about "essential energy" the soul.  Does that go into the air too?  You think there's a good energy and a bab energy?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I don't know.  Where are we going?

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: It's a surprise.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: What is this place?

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Remember in the diary - Nancy said that she kept finding herself in a boiler room?  Fred Krueger worked here.  It's an old power- plant - a steam generator!

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Here.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: So, you feeling anything?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: I thought you might be able to make a connection.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Any ghosts in here?

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: C'mon, cut it out.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Well, what am I supposed to do?

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: I don't know.  Concentrate or some- thing.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I feel like a jerk.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Shhh.  Just concentrate.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Anything?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Uh-uh.  Wait...

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Disappointed?

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: About what?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: About not finding any bogey men?

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: I'll get over it.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Maybe it only happens when you're sleeping - that's the way it was with Nancy, wasn't it?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Now, there's an idea we can take off on.  Maybe we should drive out to the beach tonight and lay out a couple of blankets and...  Until I fall asleep.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Maybe we can do that.  Strictly scientific, of course.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Nancy went bonkers from this thing. You wouldn't be afraid of being out on the beach with a potential lunatic?

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Ghostbusters are fearless.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: What is it - What's wrong?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Whoa!

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I don't know - a sharp pain.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: It's gone now.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Oh, Jesse...

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Will you stop and tell me what's wrong?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I'm fine.  Nothing's wrong.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: you didn't say more than two words to me the whole way here.  You had another nightmare, didn't you?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: yeah, I had a bad night.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: You want to talk about it?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: My Dad thinks I'm on drugs, my Mom thinks I'm crazy and I'm not sure I don't agree with her.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: You should eat something - you'll feel better.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I'm not hungry.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: I wish you'd talk to me.  We can figure it out, you know.  We can figure it out together.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: There's nothing to figure out.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I think I better go.  I'm just not into it tonight.  I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Why won't you talk to me?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Will you leave me alone?  Please.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: You're not being fair to me.  I'm worried about you and I want to help you get through this thing.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: What are you gonna do?  How are you gonna help?  I'm losing my mind.  I don't want to have you watch me fall apart.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I'm afraid to go to sleep, I'm afraid to stay awake - I'm ruining your party. They're gonna put me away for sure.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: We'll figure it out together.  We'll stay up all night if we have to.  I won't let anything happen to you.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Jesse, God - what happened?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I killed him!  I killed him!

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Oh, Christ, you're hurt...

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I killed Grady.  I killed Grady, Lisa. I killed Schneider.  Oh my God, he's inside me...

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Who, Jesse?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: he's just waiting to take me.  When I sleep.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Who?  Who's doing this to you?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Fred Krueger.  He's been trying to get hold of me, to use me.  He needs me to get out of his world into ours...He's gonna take me again.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: No, Jesse.  This isn't happening. It's gotta be everything you've taken in -- Schneider and the diary and the glove -- only it's all mixed up.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: You created him - you can destroy him. He lives off your fear.  Fight him, Jesse!

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I can't!

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: What's so funny?

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: We must look like a couple of escapees from a veterans' hospital.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: 'Morning.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: 'Morning, honey.
